text:
Easy to verify via

% telnet host 8080
GET / foo bar HTTP/1.1
Host: host

Then
curl http://host:8080/

then look in access log.

I realize its debatable whether or not 505s should be logged, but I am trying to debug a 505 right now and it should would be helpful.  At the very least, a config option that enabled logging of 505s would be nice.  Fwiw, Apache HTTPd 2.0 logs 505s.
creator: eric.bloch@gmail.com
markt@apache.org
text:
Tomcat rejects the request as early as possible in the processing chain. This particular error causes the request to be rejected a fair way before the request reaches the access log valve.

It would require fairly large changes to the request processing chain for this request (or all requests) to reach the access log valve.

I am therefore marking this as WONTFIX. To debug this issue you could use httpd in front of Tomcat with mod_proxy_http and utilise httpd's access logging if it gives you what you need.

Btw, logging 505s also seems useful wrt tracking down potential abuse.  As I persoused the src code it seems like there are other error responses that may not get logged as well, including some 400s, 500s, and 503s.
